You’ll also ensure that purchase orders are placed on suppliers to meet the requirements from sites in terms of best price, quality, and delivery date. Your other tasks will include sourcing and negotiating with new suppliers of materials, where no contract is in place, and ensuring contribution to the overall procurement savings. As a team, we support each other and highly value team relationships and a positive working atmosphere.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>creating and following up on purchase orders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring on-time delivery from suppliers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being the single point contact for requisitioners and interface to stakeholders and suppliers.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a relevant technical or commercial education at a master’s or bachelor’s level <\u002Fli>\n  <li>possess strong SAP skills and negotiation experience <\u002Fli>\n  <li>have experience with various types of procurement, i.e., services, supplies, and works<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preferably have substantial relevant experience with supply chain and logistics or procurement and contract management <\u002Fli>\n  <li>preferably have experience with supply chain and logistics and construction of offshore wind farms and power plants.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 28 February 2023. As a team, we focus on a healthy work-life balance and we support flexible working hours, which will allow you to focus on your education and prepare yourself for the exams and projects. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb>(After proper training)<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> clarifying the requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> creating technical documentation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working on less complex development or configuration with mentor guidance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> dispatching incidents<\u002Fli>\n  <li> solving incidents.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>are curious and eager to learn new things<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a communicative person and a team player <\u002Fli>\n  <li>speak and write English, as our corporate language is English <\u002Fli>\n  <li>are detail-oriented and thorough when completing your tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are interested in growing your knowledge and skills in IT.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. foundations for our offshore wind farms<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll design structural components for monopile and jacket foundations for offshore wind turbines, from the conceptual phase to the detailed design and installed design, incl. as-built documentation. You’ll also have the opportunity to participate in development work, such as calculation methods and calculation tools.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Welcome to Structures and Loads<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> You’ll be part of Secondary Structures where you, together with your colleagues, will improve on methods, tools, and best practices for the design of secondary structures such as boat landings, platforms, anode support structures, and ladders. We’re a global team of thirty people comprising nine nationalities that has a continual focus on different cultures and diversity.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> You’ll play an important role in:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> designing, calculating, and documenting structural components<\u002Fli>\n  <li> the development of best practices, calculation methods, and calculation tools<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working with CAD technicians and helping them create and develop drawings and 3D models<\u002Fli>\n  <li> collaborating with your colleagues and implementing lessons learned and new solutions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> inspecting your own design work at production sites and offshore installation sites if you’re interested in taking on that task, too.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> have a relevant master’s degree in engineering, e.g., within civil or mechanical engineering, preferably with moderate experience with offshore structures, e.g., jackets or monopiles<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a good sense of optimised design of steel structures and a good understanding of cost production-friendly design, as well as some experience with the design of structures exposed to fatigue<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have detailed knowledge of the design and verification of steel structures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have detailed knowledge of FE modelling in ANSYS, or a similar FE programme<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English fluently<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good communication skills and thrive on being proactive in relation to your colleagues spread across diverse locations around the globe.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a world leader in green energy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Ørsted is a global leader in offshore wind energy and ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company. To be a frontrunner, we invest significantly in employee development and from the moment you join us, we’ll support your personal and professional growth. Here, you’ll get the opportunities that will unleash your full potential, and you’ll experience a collaborative, diverse, and dynamic work environment.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Send your application to us no later than 22 January 2023. Collectively, you'll be responsible for supporting all Payroll activity within your dedicated area, as well as supporting global initiatives where required. The UK Payroll team sits within Global People Services, an exciting area which has developed to support the growth of our business. As a team, we cooperate together and highly value team relationships and a positive working atmosphere. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> preparing and maintaining documentation according to UK regulations, ensuring proper payroll processes in cooperation with external payroll providers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> serving as the single point of contact in UK region for payroll and tax-related matters<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring that all HR systems are used efficiently, improving the data input, and working with payroll to link HR SAP and payroll software<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working with review processes to increase efficiency and improve the level of service GPS offered to the organisation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have an advanced understanding and knowledge of UK payroll <\u002Fli>\n  <li>are familiar with UK law and regulations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can communicate effectively and smoothly in English, both in writing and orally<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess experience working with and setting up shared service centres<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a demonstrable track record of being able to create simple and practical solutions for complex processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can plan, prioritise, and work independently, as well as being open to business needs. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. We’re an ambitious team who’s passionate about moving our team and our colleagues forward. We work flexibly and collaboratively – often in a virtual setting. You’ll have opportunities to continuously learn and develop through access to challenging professional experiences and industry-leading experts<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>owning the development and execution of GTA processes, roadmap and service level strategy to enable efficiency, experience, and continuous improvement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> establishing and being the global process owner for GTA<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing partnerships with a wide set of stakeholders across HR and our organisation, e.g., Talent Acquisition Operations, Employer Branding &amp; HR Communication, and Talent Pipelines <\u002Fli>\n  <li>conducting training, documentation and change readiness activities related to GTA processes incl. GTA and hiring manager upskilling<\u002Fli>\n  <li> partnering with the Talent Acquisition Tech &amp; Tooling Lead to ensure our technology and tools support our GTA processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing vendor relationships, incl. job boards and assessment providers. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have experience with leading and developing talent acquisition processes and tools in a global matrix organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with SAP SuccessFactors or a similar ATS tool and experience with leveraging and integrating efficient processes with IT tools<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent stakeholder management skills, enabling you to manage expectations, communicate effectively, and develop relationships with global stakeholders to build, visibility and credibility<\u002Fli>\n  <li> work structured and independently by planning and prioritising your work to persevere through challenging and complex circumstances<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have great facilitation and collaboration skills, enabling you to lead the collaborative development of processes, decisions, and results.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. Besides the ongoing daily operations, team members participate in relevant projects, e.g., PeoplePortal, onboarding, and D&amp;I events. We also drive global processes, incl. reporting, knowledge management, and analytics. As a team, we cooperate together, and team relations and atmosphere are key.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>handling the recruitment process in our recruitment system, creating the recruitment projects, keeping the projects updated throughout the process, and completing them when the project is closed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing invites for tests and test results, as well as the booking of job interviews<\u002Fli>\n  <li> handling questions and requests from managers, candidates, and talent acquisition partners<\u002Fli>\n  <li> implementing our global recruitment process in new countries.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a clerical education, or similar<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are experienced with administrative tasks, Excel, Outlook, and correspondence via email<\u002Fli>\n  <li> enjoy having many ongoing tasks at the same time and can handle these professionally<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive on being in contact with colleagues and candidates from all over the world<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can communicate effectively and smoothly in English, both in writing and orally.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. We’re a diverse team, starting to have a global footprint. Our values are driven by the nature of our roles in the project, which is characterised by independent decision taking, responsibility, and flexibility. We embrace the advantages of a matrix organisation in which we, as a team, develop the role together, share learnings among colleagues, and support each other. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>managing the technical aspects of the wind turbine and access systems supplier contracts within specific wind farm projects, evaluating risks, and identifying opportunities for improvements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring technical requirements and interfaces for wind turbines are met, in cooperation with the supplier and internal interfaces, e.g., Foundation and Operations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the quality assurance of the project deliveries from our wind turbine suppliers, as well as their sub-suppliers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> following up on technical issues during the design, fabrication, and installation phases, transferring learning from one project to the next.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in mechanical engineering, or a similar technical background<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preferably have experience with system or component design of wind turbines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preferably have practical experience with executing asset projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preferably have a background of practical mechanical experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in an international environment and enjoy creating good relationships with a set of diverse stakeholders. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Kristin Hoej Kjeldsen, Head of Wind Turbine Execution, on (Denmark +45) 99558012 on Mondays to Fridays from 08:30-15:00 CET; Central European Time if you’d like to know more about the position. high-quality processes to support our global quality agenda <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be part of a team of highly skilled process experts, enabling all colleagues globally to better understand their role and execute their daily work through the development, optimisation, and implementation of processes in our ISO-certified management system.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Business Process Improvement<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Process Excellence Business Partners where you, together with your colleagues, will be a trusted advisor, recognised as subject matter expert on processes and our management system. You’ll be responsible for helping create, improve, and implement processes in collaboration with stakeholders across the business, supporting them with workshops, training, and coaching. We're a friendly, inclusive team consisting of eight people based across Denmark, Poland, and the UK, who work flexibly to support our colleagues across the globe to better understand, create and follow processes. As a team, we collaborate closely to share our knowledge and create a culture of learning and continuous improvement<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>acting as a main point of contact for our stakeholders, answering questions, and offering expert advice on processes and our management system<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving our agenda for standardisation and optimisation of existing processes, ensuring alignment and strong interfaces across technologies, regions, and departments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting process owners globally with development, improvement, and standardisation through delivery of workshops and facilitation of training on process mapping and methodology<\u002Fli>\n  <li> securing the highest levels of quality in our business processes, ensuring they are simple, easy to follow, and in line with our internal conventions and best practice standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the robust implementation and continuous improvement of processes across the organisation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have experience of working with process management systems and are familiar with process mapping techniques, principles, and best practice, as well as ISO standards and certification requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a skilled facilitator and presenter, with experience of delivering workshops and training<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can communicate complex information in a simple, easy to follow manner and effectively engage your audience, motivating them to standardise and improve their processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> love working with a variety of stakeholders with different needs and have a natural ability to network and build respectful, collaborative relationships<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have an eye for detail and take pride in delivering high quality work, putting an emphasis on simplicity and accuracy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are fluent in spoken and written English as you will deal with international stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 29 January 2023. We’re a team of 60 offshore installation managers, specialists, and engineers who share complementary skills and a common commitment to delivering high quality work. You will be cooperating closely together with colleagues across Europe, the US, and APAC. In our department we embrace learning opportunities, personal development, and continuous improvement to processes. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>planning and designing the offshore cable installation works<\u002Fli>\n  <li> tendering process and contract negations with sub suppliers and contractors for the offshore cable installations works<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being responsible for the interfaces to internal and external stakeholders, e.g., HV cables, foundations, CPS, authorities, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being responsible towards the installation contractor and managing progress, time, and budget<\u002Fli>\n  <li> closing the projects, incl. documentation, lessons learned, and hand over to O&amp;M.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold a bachelor’s degree in engineering together with previous experience in offshore cable installation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can contribute to solving challenging issues within a complex matrix organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive working in an international environment and are able to create good relationships with your stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a structured, service minded, and flexible approach to your tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are an excellent communicator who speaks and writes English fluently.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. centre, in close collaboration with the management team<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for the development and execution of key initiatives for our Ørsted Business Services global management team. You’ll work to accelerate the operational excellence of the main services delivered by ØBS: Procure-to-Pay, Order-to-Cash, Record-to-report, Hire-to-Retire, and new services required to be standardised and delivered to existing or new business areas. You’ll be part of a team that sets new standards for shared services. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>leading and coordinating strategic initiatives across ØBS supporting our senior management team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> identifying areas in our processes that can benefit from re-design to cater for increased complexity and growth in our organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> defining decision proposals based on a structured and data-driven approach<\u002Fli>\n  <li> championing the application of best-practice methods for business development and structured problem solving.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a master’s degree, preferably from a finance or economics-related field<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience from a major consultancy or global corporation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are results-oriented, independent, and ambitious.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Send your application to us no later than 23 February 2023. analytics solutions<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll have a unique opportunity to develop your professional competences in Power BI by working with platform governance and administration, stabilising performance, and resolving very complex incidents that very often need direct coordination with Microsoft. In our team, we handle multiple data technologies, incl. Azure, HANA, Business Objects, and Tableau, based on agile methodology delivery. Our project team is IT driven and consists of ten consultants sharing a passion for Business intelligence. In this team, it is important to demonstrate a perseverant approach when proposing design and excellence when developing solutions. As a Senior Consultant, you’ll report to the Head of ERP Development and Analytics, as well as the product owner accountable for the solution. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>monitoring, maintaining, improving, and upgrading our Power BI solution on a regular basis by taking over tasks set by the Technical Applications Responsible<\u002Fli>\n  <li> performing landscape administration tasks e.g., setting up and maintaining gateways, auditing licenses, and developing best practices for business users<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing proactive support for application and operational issues across the production environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working closely with the business while developing end-to-end solutions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> handling various requests related to our Power BI platform.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have experience with Power BI Service, Power BI Premium administration, and, possibly, landscape governance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a knack for configuring and troubleshooting gateways, using REST API for Power BI, and built custom connectors<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can troubleshoot and develop Power BI reports, incl. As a team, we are keen on providing the best solutions for our projects and we do so by harnessing the lessons learnt from our track record of previous projects and combining that with frontend technology.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>creating and updating project HR plans with input from relevant stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> carrying out progress updates in terms of activities and resources<\u002Fli>\n  <li> communicating and reporting progress, performance, and forecasts on a regular basis<\u002Fli>\n  <li> harnessing your professional and personal skills and insights to support management decision-making for the project.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a genuine interest in project management support and a service mindset<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a proactive and structured approach to your work and a good eye for detail<\u002Fli>\n  <li> demonstrate good interpersonal skills enabling you to build strong relations with other project members<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good communication skills, enabling you to communicate with colleagues at different levels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> work well in teams but are also able to take initiative and manage own workload<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preferably have project planning experience and general knowledge of project management.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 15 February 2023. solutions <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for the support, maintenance, and development of our global virtualisation products. In this role, you'll interface with colleagues across teams and borders and, with your knowledge and insights, will be an inspiration and anchor for developing our virtualisation platform.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Infrastructure and Service Operations Competence Centre<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of IT Production Infrastructure team where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for designing, executing, and maintaining virtualisation architecture in the organisation. We collaborate closely with the whole IT Production Product Line where we design and execute our IT infrastructure solution supporting Ørsted Production sites. As a team, we take responsibility of our own development and, most importantly, set a friendly collaboration atmosphere.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>maintaining and supporting our existing Cisco Intersight and CIMC Installation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> maintaining, extending, and supporting existing PowerShell scripts handling VMware, Cisco Intersight, and Cisco CIMC\u002FUCS<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring compliance across the vShere, UCS, and ACI platform<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting and maintaining our server platform which also includes HPE Servers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing and supporting Kubernetes in an on-prem environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> liaising with our network and VMware operations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have experience with deep troubleshooting for issues regarding Cisco Intersight, Cisco UCS, and ACI – vSphere integration in an Enterprise environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> understand the integration between Cisco network technologies and the vSphere platform on an architectural level and are therefore proficient in troubleshooting the integration between vSphere and Cisco network including ACI<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are used to working with REST APIs and PowerShell<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have knowledge about HPE servers and HPE Oneview<\u002Fli>\n  <li> would like to work in a diverse and international environment with many different nationalities and cultures.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. class by providing excellent administrative support for our Procure to Pay (P2P) process<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll focus your efforts on supporting the entire business in its P2P process and ensuring that we work as a professional, reliable, and responsible organisation. You’ll be the point of contact for Sourcing &amp; Category Managers, as well as Data Quality, Accounts Payable, and Finance, and you’ll participate in network activities with other procurement coordinators. In addition, you’ll assist project managers and your colleagues with specific project tasks and administrative tasks related to procurement.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Welcome to Financial Services<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Operational Procurement team where you, together with your colleagues, will be in daily communication with stakeholders regarding matters related to the P2P process. You’ll create a purchase order based on a received request. You’ll perform the invoice control in SAP, including verification of information on the invoice versus the agreement before release, and you’ll also handle issues related to allocation of purchase orders to the relevant contract. The team is responsible for supporting all functions with procurement processes in SAP. As a team, we support each other to develop and value knowledge sharing and good collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> being the single point of contact for requisitioners within procurement processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting requisitioners and sharing information regarding the P2P process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the P2P flow from creation of purchase orders until processing of invoices, incl. allocation of suppliers and contract information<\u002Fli>\n  <li> assisting with financial tasks related to purchase orders and invoicing, incl. following up on purchase orders and performing invoice control<\u002Fli>\n  <li> assisting with logistics tasks related to purchase orders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> have a bachelor’s degree or another equivalent academic background<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have moderate business experience from an international company, preferably with a background in procurement, finance, logistics, or accounting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess business-level English language skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are an experienced user of the Microsoft Office suite and SAP, in particular the Purchase to Pay and Finance\u002FControlling modules.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a world leader in green energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a global leader in offshore wind energy and ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company. As a team, we cooperate together and highly value team relationships and a positive working atmosphere. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>managing the administrative work of the UK HR team and close cooperation with the People Manager<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing and maintaining documentation according to UK regulations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> handling and describing HR processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing a seamless HR onboarding process, in collaboration with key internal and external stakeholders, to ensure that employees are aware of employee benefits and HR policies.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have an advanced understanding of UK law and HR administration<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have process-leading skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a demonstrable track record of being able to create simple and practical solutions for complex processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are able to plan, prioritise, and work independently, as well as being available and responsive to business needs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are familiar with Success Factors.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Ilona Rainko, Global People Services Team Leader, on (Poland +48) 506977100, if you’d like to know more about the position. execution of our high voltage AC and DC substations <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for the design, quality assurance, and integration of the LV and utility components into onshore and offshore substations from the conceptual phase to detailed design and execution phases. You’ll also have the opportunity to participate in the development of innovative technical solutions and in assisting our O&amp;M team.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Welcome to Power Transmission<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Electrical and Mechanical Engineering where you, together with your talented and motivated colleagues, will contribute to the design, sourcing, integration, and execution of the LV scopes within high voltage AC and DC substations, both onshore and offshore. You’ll also work closely with our Asset Integrity team to assist them reducing OPEX costs. You’ll get the opportunity to work in a diverse international team who’ll help you get on board our team and company.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>being responsible for verifying the design of LV and utility systems on offshore and onshore substations during all project phases, from concept to FAT<\u002Fli>\n  <li> taking ownership and delivering technical specifications, employer requirements, and design basis and verifying calculations associated with the LV and utility components for both ONSS and OSS<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring that the deliverables from engineering, fabrication, and principal contractors have the right quality according to requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> participating in FAT\u002FSAT of main LV and utility systems on onshore and offshore substations to support supervision and commissioning activities, as well as handover to our O&amp;M team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> assisting our Asset Integrity Team (O&amp;M) in planning the maintenance campaign, troubleshooting, and taking over new assets from the EPC team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> participating in project team meetings and proactively cooperating and coordinating with internal and external stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a relevant degree in electrical engineering and are interested in working with electrical design for onshore and offshore substations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have extensive experience with technical design requirements for LV and utilities, incl. fire alarm systems, UPS, lightning system, monitoring systems, switchboards, power management system, etc., preferably within offshore substations or offshore oil and gas projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have hands-on experience with LV power system design and studies, calculations, equipment sizing, and specifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have extensive experience with relevant international standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience from working in maintenance departments and a track record of implementing maintenance improvement plans<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are curious and open for new ways of working with new design processes and are able to collaborate with your team members and all stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a farms in the world in an exciting and fast-growing industry<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll design the power system of our offshore wind farms and carry out power system studies to a power system designs team where you, together with your colleagues, have a key role in optimising our wind farm designs, while pushing the boundaries of what’s technically possible. The department is highly diverse and comprises more than 50 highly skilled engineers working across six countries to ensure electrical integration of our future offshore wind farms into an increasing number of markets across the globe.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> You’ll play an important role in:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> designing and developing concepts for the overall electrical power transmission system from the onshore substation to the wind turbine generator<\u002Fli>\n  <li> performing power system studies on the wind farm, including power flow, voltage control, dynamic analysis, fault ride through, stability and harmonic studies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> participating in relevant project meetings and cooperating with other team members on shared issues<\u002Fli>\n  <li> handling project tasks such as optimisation and cost benefit analyses, support of decision processes, and documenting the technical solutions and analyses.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> have completed a degree in electrical engineering<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with power system analysis using simulation tools like PowerFactory and PSCAD<\u002Fli>\n  <li> may have some experience with transmission systems, generation, or renewable energy <\u002Fli>\n  <li>have a proactive, results-oriented, and systematic approach to your work tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English fluently.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a world leader in green energy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Ørsted is a global leader in offshore wind energy and ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company. As a team, we are ambitious, with a great energy and an informal work culture, and we highly encourage a learning mindset and an original approach to new projects.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>working with Global Talent Acquisition to identify needs and opportunities in relation to data accuracy and availability to inform decisions based on people data and analyses<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing and executing the Global Talent Acquisition data and analytics roadmap<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing PowerBI reports to serve as dashboards and scorecards for Global Talent Acquisition and the business<\u002Fli>\n  <li> analysing data and presenting findings and recommendations to the Global Talent Acquisition leadership team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing data literacy and capability within our talent acquisition community, as well as within the business.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold a master’s degree in, e.g., business administration, economy, strategy, HR, or equivalent experience, and are passionate about data-driven decision making<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have great stakeholder management skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can turn data into easily understandable and actionable business insights<\u002Fli>\n  <li> pay attention to detail and set high standards for your work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ideally, bring industry best practices to challenge thinking and bring innovation to how we think about and leverage data and analytics.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 22 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Jesper Petersen, , on (Denmark +45) 99559747, if you’d like to know more about the position. Permanent"},"jobTagModel":null,"resumeEvaluationResult":null,"sanitizedJobDescription":{"content":"<div>\n <p>Imagine a future where you support our green energy transformation by supervising the operation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of our offshore windfarms <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll support our Polish and German programs of offshore wind farms. You’ll be supervising teams that are responsible for high voltage and low voltage commissioning, maintenance, operation, and troubleshooting of equipment in accordance with our electrical safety rules.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Electrical Safety <\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Electrical Safety team where you, together with your colleagues, will supervise colleagues operating, maintaining, and repairing equipment throughout the region and you’ll head a team of highly skilled high voltage senior authorized persons. While on site, you’ll report directly to the lead commissioning wind farm manager and your functional line manager for your further development. We cultivate a safety-focused, collaborative, dynamic, and diverse work environment and encourage career-long learning and development so our people can realise their full potential. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>maintaining safety of all persons working on or near high voltage electrical equipment throughout commissioning, energisation, testing, and long-term operation of new windfarm facilities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading teams of senior authorized persons and providing them with regular work direction<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting wind farm commissioning project management in witnessing and executing acceptance tests, energisation, and commissioning scope throughout the construction phase<\u002Fli>\n  <li> fostering a culture of safety at new offshore windfarm facilities in Germany and Poland, as well as mentoring and training team members on our electrical safety rules<\u002Fli>\n  <li> overseeing high voltage electrical installations to wind turbines, offshore substations, HV sub-marine and onshore cables, onshore substations, and grid connections.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have at least seven years of electrical working and maintenance experience operating under a safe system of high voltage work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have at least three years working experience within onshore substation systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience managing high voltage switching activities up to 400 kV<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are willing to work offshore during commissioning time periods and able to clear medical checks and safety training programs as required by Global Wind Organisation (GWO) standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> become certified as a senior authorized person under our electrical safety rules and subsequently trained to become a lead senior authorized person.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Joergen Elmstroem, Head of Electrical Safety, on (+1) 8572751478, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that you’re expected to do regular travelling in relation to your work, as you’ll be working in different construction sites both offshore and onshore, with onshore locations in Emden in Germany, Warsaw in Poland, and Copenhagen in Denmark.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most setup in creating a world that runs entirely on green energy<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be part of an ambitious agile transformation, maturing virtual, cross-functional Agile Centre<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> You’ll be part of Agile Competency Centre, a global community of agile professionals, where you, together with your colleagues, will support various Agile Release Trains (ARTs) and IT value streams across the company in their journey. As Agile Coach, you’ll also work closely with Agile @ Ørsted Centre of Excellence to improve lean agile capabilities across Ørsted IT. As a team, we’re driven by the outcomes we’re helping our colleagues to achieve, and we take an experimental, collaborative approach to solving the needs and problems of our internal customers.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>coaching and mentoring Teams and ART Leadership around scaled agile framework and Lean-Agile Leadership<\u002Fli>\n  <li> continuously improving and adjusting the operating model supporting the agile ways of working, based on the scaled Agile framework and together with other Agile Coaches<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring the transparent communication and distribution of Agile ways of working to the rest of the organisation, whilst having a solid understanding of the change management aspect of the process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the scrum master, product owners, and agile teams in meeting the business requirements, MVPs, and KPIs – and helping them achieve value<\u002Fli>\n  <li> conducting SAFe and agile training sessions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the use of Azure DevOps, the tool we use to manage backlogs, create dashboards for Teams and ART Leadership, etc.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold a master's degree within Business or Technology and possess a relevant SAFe certification, preferably SPC<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have solid experience as an agile coach, scrum master, lean specialist, or similar, as well as extensive experience with enabling an agile transformation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a true lean agile mindset and an understanding of lean portfolio management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a strong facilitator and maintain a professional tone in leading processes and workshops with an open mind, whilst challenging assumptions and building trust<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can vary your personal style and float between different roles in response to your target audience, incl. coach, advisor, servant leader, and supporter <\u002Fli>\n  <li>are an outgoing personality and have positive people-person mindset with excellent communication and collaboration skills - and a flair for diplomacy. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 10 February 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Magda Szleszynska-Szczap, Head of Agile &amp; Capacity, on (Poland +48) 789869536, if you’d like to know more about the position. This community consists of 100+ architects working with the business through an Agile delivery organisation, whilst ensuring great cohesion and a platform for high-quality knowledge sharing. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>working with core engineering teams at the heart of wind-farm design <\u002Fli>\n  <li>providing guidance to developers and engineers related to applications architecture and infrastructure components<\u002Fli>\n  <li> advising and overseeing the implementation of technology that maximises security, reliability, maintainability, scalability, usability, and efficiency<\u002Fli>\n  <li> cooperating with the Solution Architect to ensure alignment with overall Architectural Runway and portfolio targets<\u002Fli>\n  <li> adhering to our standards within OT and IT Security to plan and design the right architecture.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>can clearly communicate technological capabilities to engineers and developers <\u002Fli>\n  <li>ideally have knowledge of one of the following: Azure, AWS, or GCP, incl. knowledge of high-performance storage<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a broad understanding of, and an ability to assess, new and future technologies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are future-oriented whilst focusing your architect’s perspective on daily challenges, in direct collaboration with engineers <\u002Fli>\n  <li>have an ability to communicate architectural designs and decisions effectively and proactively to team members, the business, and IT stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can orchestrate SAFe principles and nurture good collaboration with colleagues globally.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Pawel Kropielnicki, Head of Architecture ＆ Security, on (Poland +48) 507972013 on Mondays to Fridays from 08:30-16:00 CET; Central European Time, if you’d like to know more about the position. wind farm development projects<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be part of a team that develops global wind farm projects. You’ll be given the responsibility to assess and optimise wind farm conceptual designs.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Wind Farm Concept Integration<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Concept Integration, a growing team of 10+ enthusiastic and highly skilled colleagues. Together with your colleagues, you’ll work closely with a wide range of stakeholders in a global setup, covering all technical and commercial aspects of the wind farm design. Our mission is to deliver the best decision basis for global wind farm development opportunities across regions. You’ll be reporting to the Head of Concept Integration and project managers. We have many stakeholders within the organisation, allowing for ample learning and improvement opportunities. As a team we’re diverse, with a range of shared talents that are action-orientated and service-minded with expert knowledge of wind farm engineering.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>optimising planned wind farm layouts, conceptual technical designs, and installation set-ups to improve the technical solution and business case<\u002Fli>\n  <li> analysing and coordinating internal and external stakeholders’ input in relation to the technical design envelope and consent or permitting processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> coordinating, challenging, and ensuring alignment across all business case drivers, incl. technical specifications, capital, operational and abandonment expenditures, energy yield, and risk<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing how we work with our service offerings and processes through improved methodologies, tools, and new technology, in collaboration with the team and stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>preferably have a master’s degree in engineering or a similar discipline<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with offshore wind farms or offshore work within the field of wind turbines, electrical systems, or offshore installation processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a good analytical understanding of the cross-disciplinary dynamic between technical solutions and business cases<\u002Fli>\n  <li> enjoy working with many stakeholders and tasks and have strong communication and collaboration skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 20 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Julian Ralf Jensen, Head of Wind Farm Concept Integration, on +45 9955 6187 if you’d like to know more about the position. keeping track of their spend. Your primary working tools will be SAP and Excel, the latter at an advanced level. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Welcome to EPCO Finance &amp; Regional Support<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Shared Function Finance where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for cost forecasting, reporting, and internal allocations for all shared functions in Ørsted at a global scale. You'll have ten dedicated Finance colleagues across Poland and Denmark. We’re individually responsible for specific stakeholders, but we share tools and knowledge in the team in a structured way. As a team, we’re service partners to Shared Functions while at the same time creating cost awareness and being a challenger.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>following up on spend in Group Stakeholder Relations and in Group Procurement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> delivering operational financial support and ad hoc analyses to relevant managers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> overseeing the internal allocation of cost in a fair and transparent way<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring high data quality through controlling, month-end accruals, optimising processes, and correcting errors.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>enjoy working with details and have an analytical and structured approach to your tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are an experienced user of Excel and preferably also SAP<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Finance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are skilled in interacting with both specialists and business managers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have some experience with management reporting and are a skilled communicator<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are fluent in English.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. We focus on your career aspirations and your personal development.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to HVDC and Grid Stabilising Equipment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> You’ll be part of a diverse and inclusive team of highly skilled engineers where you, together with your colleagues, will be conducting engineering tasks related to sourcing, manufacturing, and installation of HV equipment. We’re involved in the entire lifecycle of our offshore wind power projects, from the early stages of project development until handover of the energised wind farm. The team has a vital role in ensuring the most cost-effective solutions related to HVDC and grid stabilising equipment. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>developing and maintaining technical requirements and participating in technical clarifications for sourcing of HV equipment for HVDC transmission systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving technical development in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> aligning and optimising electrical and mechanical interfaces with key stakeholders, such as the structural engineering department and the electrical system design department<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring the quality of HV equipment through compliance with our quality process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> optimising the wind farm infrastructure and participating in innovative new cost-efficient solutions.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a strong knowledge of and experience within HVDC systems and preferably also power electronic technologies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a master’s degree or maybe a PhD in electrical engineering<\u002Fli>\n  <li> understand electrical transmission system design requirements and how power electronic-based equipment can be utilised to improve grid stability and system performance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have personal drive combined with a structured and proactive approach to your work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are self-driven combined with a collaborative approach, enabling you to thrive in a team.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Jakob Boss Skaarhoej, Head of HVDC &amp; Grid StabilizingEquipment, on (Denmark +45) 99556864, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We offer a flexible workplace and, in this position, you’ll be working in a hybrid set-up. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application help create a world that runs entirely on green energy <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll take the responsibility for post payroll accounting and reporting processes concerning the Group’s legal entities in Central Europe &amp; UK.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Global People Services<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Accounting Team where you, together with your colleagues, will be The team sits within Global People Services in Central Europe &amp; UK, an exciting area which has developed to support the growth of our business. As a team, we cooperate together and team relations and atmosphere are key.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>supporting accounting procedures to ensure accurate post-payroll reporting, controlling the transactions, and reconciling the accounts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving the continuous optimisation of processes, specifically in connection with month-end and accruals reporting and payroll accounting <\u002Fli>\n  <li>reconciling entities’ accounts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing master data and introducing process automation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> serving as the single point of contact for post payroll and tax-related matters<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring proper post payroll processes in cooperation with external payroll providers.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have an analytical and logical approach to issues, as well as the ability to critically handle information you receive<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have accounting experience, preferably in an international company, and have worked with finance IT systems, preferably with SAP <\u002Fli>\n  <li>have outstanding analytical skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a strong personal drive<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English at an academic level, can communicate clearly in writing, and excel at communicating financial issues in a readily understandable language.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. On a day-to-day basis, you’ll be joining scrum ceremonies and delivering value on an iterative basis, whilst also having fun.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>developing products to support wind farm operations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working with systems consisting of multiple services deployed in Kubernetes cluster and frontend client developed in Angular<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working with platforms fully deployed in Azure (AKS, Azure SQL, Azure Service Bus etc.) and managed in Azure DevOps<\u002Fli>\n  <li> the entire development lifecycle.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>can collaborate with diverse teams across the entire company<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent programming proficiency in Python<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good understanding of web concepts, such as REST<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good understanding of Angular and practical knowledge of SQL and Git<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good knowledge of design patterns, good practices, and clean code<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are proactive with analytical skills and the ability to multitask.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. rapidly growing global offshore wind market <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll play a key part in the success of the project. You’ll manage all commissioning activities for the Wind Turbine Generator (WTG) scope onshore at pre-assembly and offshore, until hand-over to the O&amp;M customer. You’ll be coordinating among stakeholders, managing day-to-day challenges, and taking risk-based decisions to ensure best quality and earliest possible power generation.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Fabrication &amp; Commissioning<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Fabrication &amp; Commissioning where you, together with your colleagues, will plan and take care of the entire WTG commissioning scope. You’ll be an integral part of a team with competent and committed colleagues who’ll support you along the way.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>taking a proactive approach to meet HSE, quality, and reliability targets<\u002Fli>\n  <li> planning and managing scope, time, budget, and resources for supervising the WTG Commissioning activities carried out by the WTG contractor and other sub-contractors to ensure contract compliance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> the daily management of WTG Commissioning supervisors and inspectors, incl. prioritisation of WTG inspection activities, coordination of absence, receipts, and signing of time sheets<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring WTG commissioning activities comply with internal and external requirements and specifications, whilst following local legislation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> reporting WTG commissioning progress to the WTG project manager.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree, as well as experience with quality management and risk management, and have a passion for technology<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are highly safety-oriented and have strong focus on quality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> understand people and have professional experience in multicultural teams, preferably across continents<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have professional experience from the offshore industry, preferably within offshore wind, plus a self-driven attitude and the ability to cope with an ever-changing project development and execution environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong communication skills and can engage with stakeholders on different levels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess good spoken and written English skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 29th of January 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Dirk Michel, Head of Fabrication &amp; Commissioning, on +49 17 3188 27 44 if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We offer a flexible workplace, and in this position, you’ll be working in a hybrid (office- and home working) set-up. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please note that you’re expected to do extensive travelling in relation to your work, as you’ll work on projects that we execute globally, and you’ll be based at the local construction site during the project execution phase.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n <p> #LI-Hybrid<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 29 January 2023, 23:59 CEST <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> Poland, Germany <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Warsaw, Hamburg <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Hybrid (office and home-working) <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> Full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Dirk Michel <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Head of Fabrication &amp; reporting for our global shared service centre <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll take the position as product owner for the Performance Management Reporting team in our ØBS Agile Release Train. In this position you’ll work in a cross-functional agile team. The reporting platform plays an important role in accelerating the operational excellence of the main services delivered by ØBS: procure-to-pay, order-to-cash, record-to-report, and hire-to-retire.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Welcome to Ørsted Business Services<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Execution Support and the ØBS Agile Release Train where you, together with your colleagues, will develop our performance management and operational reporting on efficiency, quality and people measures. As a team, we collaborate across all departments in Ørsted Business Services and with IT according to agile methods. The team consists of skilled experts developing global methods, e.g., within areas such as process design, data analytics and decision making proposals. We focus on team empowerment and working style is proactive and collaborative.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>creating a product vision and roadmap for our performance management reporting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing the development backlog in close collaboration with leadership and the agile team, ensuring the delivery and deployment of new features goes according to plan<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing features, stories, and dependencies for planning and prioritisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing input related to the architectural runway, ensuring its verification together with the application of emerging technologies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving user-oriented business improvements.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a master’s degree, preferably in finance, economics, or related field<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience from setting up performance management reporting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a solid track record in driving user-oriented business improvements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a team-player and are eager to work in a large organisation with multiple internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in the spot between business and IT, always looking to engage your cross-functional competences.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. We respect and support each other, have a high level of trust, and focus on the development of our employees.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>being a safe base for your employees, providing safety, security, and comfort, which enables exploration and risk taking<\u002Fli>\n  <li> bringing out the inherent potential in people<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting people’s growth within a complex matrix organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> building trust-based relationships<\u002Fli>\n  <li> delivering sustainable results by inspiring others to perform at their best.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have solid experience as a people leader within the ERP Applications area<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have an agile mindset, leading and navigating in a complex, matrix organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with people development of self-managing individuals, with a great respect for the individual<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are skilled in talent development, acknowledging diverse cultural settings<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have knowledge and understanding of IT and business processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a remarkable networker experienced in stakeholder management.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. management of our network infrastructure <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll design and implement network patch management plans with proper and thorough testing. Together with your colleagues, with aligned execution and planning, you’ll provide the business with a secure and stable platform that supports our important business assets, wind farms, and power plants.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Production IT Infrastructure<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Offshore Network Patch Management team where you, together with your colleagues, will ensure the stability and security of the network infrastructure and platform. Within the SAFe framework, you’ll collaborate closely with colleagues across departments, vendors, product owners, and other business stakeholders. The department currently consist of 31 colleagues of various disciplines such as Database Administration, Windows Server, VM, Unix, Backup &amp; Archiving, Network and Solar winds. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>preparing a yearly patch calendar that is aligned with SCADA operations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> designing and executing pre and post release test cases for each patch cycle<\u002Fli>\n  <li> evaluating and implementing vendor recommendations in due time<\u002Fli>\n  <li> monitoring the network behaviours of the wind park infrastructures to ensure critical applications are achievable<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing regular reports of progress and patch levels to stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold a bachelor’s degree, preferably with a major in networking<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have specialist experience in managing network firewalls with general network administration experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with wireless LAN technologies <\u002Fli>\n  <li>are well-acquainted with routing and switching technologies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience and knowledge of SD-WAN and SDA<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess working knowledge of automation in relation to network administration, operations, and maintenance.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a world leader in green energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a global leader in offshore wind energy and ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company. targets.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have significant experience with AVEVA systems, preferably Wonderware and\u002For OSIsoft combined with products, such as System Platform, Historian, PI Server, PI Asset Framework (AF), PI Interface<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience in operating and developing enterprise level (supervisory and control) SCADA systems connecting to remote network with physical layer (field) SCADA systems handled by others<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have solid experience as an application architect and use this
