changes, so we harvest the benefits crucial for our growth<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll apply your passion for organisational change management (OCM) to help us build OCM maturity in our organisation. You’ll build change capabilities in the organisation by incorporating OCM methods and tools in our product management framework while making sure that the framework is adopted by the relevant roles in the organisation.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Agile Delivery<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of OCM Centre of Excellence (CoE) where you, together with your colleagues, will build, improve, and implement our OCM framework, incl. methods, tools, and training to ensure a uniform OCM practice, language, and mindset across the organisation. As a team, we collaborate to succeed in building the OCM competency, and we do that in a well-organised and dynamic work environment, where trust and psychological safety are at the core.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>building OCM methods and tools into the product management framework<\u002Fli>\n  <li> advising on how to succeed with the implementation and adoption of the product management framework<\u002Fli>\n  <li> defining and following up on Key Behavioural Indicators (KPIs) to create transparency around how the adoption is progressing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> executing change management activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> conducting training in OCM as well as product management.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have experience building OCM frameworks and competencies in large organisations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent stakeholder management skills and experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> naturally navigate in a cross disciplinary environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a patient and pragmatic person who can easily switch between framework development and hands on change execution<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have solid facilitation skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. contributing to the development and design of our offshore wind farms <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll follow the full design life of our projects, which spans from early design concepts to the operation and maintenance phase. You’ll be part of the in-house design team which supports the organisation by providing world-class design solutions that’ll help us reach the overall goals for the green energy transformation.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Structures &amp; Loads<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the CAD team where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for the 3D modelling and 2D documentation of our foundation designs, which are developed in collaboration with our talented teams of design engineers. You’ll be part of a skilled team where tasks and responsibilities are distributed but are all lifted by team effort. You’ll participate in both development projects and execution projects. As a team, we trust each other, and we believe that we perform the best when we share experiences and day-to-day challenges and technical knowledge in an open and honest environment.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>building and maintaining complex 3D models in Autodesk Inventor that follow our internal standards and industry practices, in collaboration with design engineers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> generating and maintaining 2D drawings based on the 3D models, which are suited for tenders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> administrating 3D and 2D files in Autodesk Vault<\u002Fli>\n  <li> importing external 3D files into our designs and exporting 3D files to our stakeholders and customers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing new ways of building our 3D models and generating 2D drawings to support changing business needs.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have an advanced sense for 3D geometries and a strong interpretation of 2D sketches<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with Autodesk Inventor and Autodesk Vault<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a team player and can adjust your own needs to the greater good of the team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can work independently and are responsible and aware of quality of tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are perseverant, takes ownership, and get the task done to the required quality.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 23 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for the support, maintenance, and development of our global network security products. the most important and challenging green energy projects <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll work closely with Asset Projects in the implementation phase and beyond to ensure that cyber risks to operational systems are understood and managed. You’ll be responsible for conducting activities such as risk assessment, cyber security countermeasure, and mitigation planning, as well as supporting SMEs in other teams in understanding OT Security requirements, describing and advising on implementation, and taking part in verification activities at FAT\u002FSAT\u002FSIT. You’ll work closely with a variety of stakeholders across the entire organisation, ensuring a focus on OT Security.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Energy Systems<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of OT Security team where you, together with your colleagues, will work closely with our other functions to further develop OT Security maturity in the organisation and support key activities in Asset Projects and Product Lines, assisting in developing consistent security services across the organisation and with vendors, driving improvements across the business. You'll be part of a diverse global team of security experts that is rapidly expanding into many different areas of the organisation. As a team, we have a strong collaborative learning culture, with an emphasis on sharing knowledge, tools, and resources and developing opportunities for those around us.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>supporting the facilitation of OT security risk assessments at module and package level to identify critical activities or interfaces and verify that these are carried out by relevant parties<\u002Fli>\n  <li> assisting the Senior OT Security Officer in preparing and following up on the OT Security Implementation Plan for each package and module<\u002Fli>\n  <li> performing OT security progress and verification reporting, in line with the requirements in the OT Security Implementation Plan and supporting internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> representing the OT Security team within relevant Product Line and Asset Project activities, e.g., vendor workshops<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting in the creation of verification documentation to support Asset Projects.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a bachelor’s degree in science, technology, engineering, or mathematics<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with cyber security in or alongside operational technologies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have some experience as an end user of security solutions, particularly in an operational environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with implementing complex solutions in challenging environments.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 20 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Klaudia Zaorska, Talent Acquisition Consultant, on (Poland +48) 573790077, if you’d like to know more about the position. In addition, you’ll work with the OT security project manager to ensure the planning, decision-making, implementation, and maintenance of the desired OT security architecture across all relevant modules and packages of energy systems projects.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Energy Systems<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the OT Security team where you, together with your colleagues, will mature OT Security in the organisation and support key activities in asset projects and product lines. You'll be part of a diverse, global team of security experts that is rapidly expanding into many different areas of our organisation. As a team, we have a strong collaborative learning culture, with an emphasis on sharing knowledge, tools, and resources and developing opportunities for those around us.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>leading OT security teams in your region and ensuring that OT security risks are addressed properly in all projects and activities within your assigned area of activity<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring that OT security risks are identified and mitigated<\u002Fli>\n  <li> communicating OT security risks to the organisation and ensuring that activities in projects are carried out to address these risks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting and guiding the OT security officers in preparing and following up on the OT security implementation plan in projects and other activities to improve security posture companywide<\u002Fli>\n  <li> representing OT security for our organisation, both with internal and external partners and stakeholders, ensuring that the latest company requirements in the area are understood by all<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing support and direction to the OT security teams in each project, ensuring that deliverables from the team meet the necessary quality standards.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a bachelor’s degree in a science, technology, engineering, or mathematics and have a background in operational technologies from an engineering, networking, or operational perspective<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a confident leader and communicator <\u002Fli>\n  <li>understand how EPC projects are developed, constructed, and operated from design through to operations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with implementing security in OT environments, preferably with experience of both network architectures and endpoint security<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with operational technologies, preferably related to the energy industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can understand compliance activities in large project organisations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 19 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Klaudia Zaorska, Talent Acquisition Consultant, on (Poland +48) 573790077 on if you’d like to know more about the position. is not something we talk about, but something we do every day <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll protect the assets of our Group from unauthorised access by transforming our security department through automation.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to PL CC Architecture &amp; Security<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Detection &amp; Vulnerability Assessment team where you, together with your colleagues, will apply technical knowledge to the environment across the Group. The skillsets include security tests, hunting, detection creation, vulnerability analysis, security monitoring, and automation to keep us at the forefront of countering contemporary and future threats to our business and the societies we operate in. As a team, we’re a passionate global group of security experts in the Cyber Defence Centre. We work in SAFe framework to make sure we’re all secure.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>developing SOAR playbooks as well as custom automations and integrations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working in partnership with other Cyber Defence Centre departments to identify and design automation opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> solving issues negatively impacting SOAR workflows<\u002Fli>\n  <li> training security analysts in automation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing support for assessment of data and technology stack effectiveness and fit-for-automation needs.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have experience working with security data and tools such as SIEM and EDR<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have technical knowledge of enterprise environments as well as Linux, MacOS, and Windows<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have the ability to automate and analyse advanced tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preferably have a background working with SOAR in a global company<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in an international environment and are able to create good relationships with your stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 10 February 2023. We focus on having a healthy work-life balance and support flexible working hours. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>developing products to support wind farm operations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> participating in the team's ceremonies with global colleagues in an optimised Agile SAFe framework<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working closely and collaborating with the internal Agile Release Train (ART) teams, external suppliers, and key resources from the business side<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving innovation and continuous technical improvement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being responsible for the technical application relating to the full development lifecycle<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing support in relation to application and operational issues across the production environment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>can collaborate with diverse teams across the entire company<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good practical knowledge of C#\u002F.NET Core, Angular, Typescript, and SQL<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a good understanding of programming best practices, good analytical skills, and an innovative mindset<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are driven to deliver value to customers and follow DevOps<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are familiar with SOLID, SOA, Kubernetes, NoSQL, and Docker<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with the Azure Cloud platform.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 28 February 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Karolina Kowalska, Head of Custom Applications Competency Centre, on (Poland +48) 451060084, if you’d like to know more about the position. expertise is key to driving the digital transformation of green energy trading <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll have the responsibility and freedom to shape test automation solutions in an ever-changing world of energy trading. You’ll develop and maintain test automation as part of our digital transformation while helping to support the existing trading platform. You’ll thrive in an international matrix organisation transforming into a global green energy leader.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Automation Competency Centre<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of TRACE Agile Release Train (ART) where you, together with your colleagues, will assure high-quality software solutions related to preparing new offshore wind farms projects. The ART consists of several product teams spread across multiple countries, delivering high-quality, cloud-based, microservice-oriented system. We appreciate good cooperation, proactiveness, and work-life balance, which so well characterises Scandinavian work culture.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>being part of a scrum team working closely with the business on delivering value and analysing business requirements to prepare automation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving test automation activities, designing the test automation framework, and developing automated test suites<\u002Fli>\n  <li> contributing to the high quality of an overall solution, incl. exploratory, integration, and performance testing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing and providing test results from automation runs and analysing test results to recommend corrective actions and manage product and project risks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> impacting and helping members of the team to build quality into the software development process by practicing TDD.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have solid experience in quality engineering area with hands-on UI software engineering experience, specifically testing, frameworks, and automation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a team player with a can-do mindset who can communicate well with different types of stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are experienced in e2e web application and API test automation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have proficiency in one of the coding languages: JavaScript \u002F TypeScript and C#<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have proven experience developing comprehensive and effective UI test automation <\u002Fli>\n  <li>preferably use tools like Playwright\u002FPuppeteer and Cypress.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. concerning the Group’s legal entities, incl. month-end closing, reconciliations, statutory accounts, as well as for performing internal controls in the Markets area. You’ll also play a large role in process optimisation, aided by your significant experience in the field.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Welcome to Financial Accounting &amp; Controlling (FAC)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> You’ll be part of the Nordic team within the Financial Accounting department where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for delivering standardised, high-quality, and timely accounting and reporting products within FAC. We provide a global financial support to the business and the wider Financial Accounting department consisting of over 40 people, based across a range of locations in Europe, North America, and Asia.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> You’ll play an important role in:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> preparing appropriate financial journals and reconciling your Market entities’ building on your knowledge in Markets, in close collaboration with our Controlling team in Denmark so the inputs and drivers behind the financial numbers are understood<\u002Fli>\n  <li> investigating current methodologies in Markets financial processes, challenging the status quo as needed, and driving change to enhance transparency and quality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the reconciliation of complex trades within gas, power, and other portfolios, supported by clear documentation suitable for audit purposes.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> have an analytical and logical approach to issues, as well as the ability to critically handle information you receive<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have relevant experience working in a dynamic finance department, preferably in an international company, and have worked with finance IT systems, with SAP experience being preferable<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience in the energy industry, ideally having worked on or in a Markets\u002FTrading part of the business<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are results-oriented and set visible and relevant goals for your tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a bachelor’s degree in accounting, controlling, finance, or similar<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English at an academic level, can communicate clearly in writing, and excel at communicating financial issues in a readily understandable language.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a world leader in green energy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Ørsted is a global leader in and offshore wind projects<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for managing design, engineering and construction activities for onshore projects from design and construction until handover to our Operations team. You’ll be responsible for the onshore project in relation to all matters pertaining to design, layout, construction, and interfaces. Additionally, you’ll ensure that all input and constraints from internal stakeholders are available in due time, from feasibility and concept studies to detailed design and construction follow-up.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Engineering<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> You’ll be part of Civil Engineering Management where you, together with your colleagues, will work with projects in all phases from idea and maturation to execution and evaluation. You‘ll be working within a core team of 15 bright and caring engineers located in five different countries. As a team, we collaborate and share knowledge daily and focus on building a trust-based culture that makes the best platform for a great learning environment and continuous feedback.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>using your technical skills to make sure that our onshore facilities and plants will be designed, constructed, and modified to ensure that internal requirements are reflected in the layout and design, incl. identifying risks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving the project deliveries within your technical discipline area covering concept layouts, requirements and specifications on design, input in tender process, and supervision of deliveries from contractors and vendors<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring procurement of contracts in collaboration with contract managers, namely preparing technical requirements i.e., project scope statements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing in-depth technical input ensuring engineering and construction are carried through, based on balanced contracts and that they are optimised in time, costs, and QHSE.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>value collaboration across your team and thrive solving complex and abstract problems together with your team across country borders\u002Fregions <\u002Fli>\n  <li>have an innovative and analytical approach to your work, with a focus on QHSE and cost effectiveness<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience in collaboration with an external design team in managing and executing a design contract for either production facilities, onshore substations, operations\u002Fmaintenance facilities, marine work via physical and virtual meetings across central Europe<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience as civil, structural engineer manager, or construction contractor and have an insight into the building project phases, concept evaluation, design and engineering, and construction <\u002Fli>\n  <li>have a degree in civil and\u002For structural engineering.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a world leader in green energy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Ørsted is a global leader in We are in the midst of a large transformation program moving from on-premises to cloud infrastructure for our trading and risk management functions.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Trading, Integration &amp; Middleware Competence Centre<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of scrum team in the Markets and Risk ART where you, together with your colleagues, will cooperate closely with other scrum teams in the ART (SAFe Agile Release Train), incl. traders, analysts, developers, and integration colleagues. We value curiosity and fun working together, therefore we combine office days with days working from home. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>developing and governing event-driven data flows<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing forward-looking data products<\u002Fli>\n  <li> defining Market and Risk architectural roadmap for data streaming<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working with a geographically and ethnically diverse team of data engineers and java developers to deliver low-latency data solutions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> interacting with stakeholders in the energy trading analytics department.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have expertise in event streaming applications, preferably Apache Kafka (Confluent Cloud etc.)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have previously worked with object-oriented programming (preferably Java\u002FPython)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are interested in developing data streaming architecture<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have DevOps experience in integrating logging, testing, monitoring, and alerting, etc. into the development, production-release, and maintenance processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> may have some previous experience (nice to have) with SQL and no-SQL database technologies: mostly MS-SQL.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 20 February 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Michal Bartos, Head of Trading, Integration ＆ Middleware, on (+48) 507367039 if you’d like to know more about the position. financial reporting by leveraging business knowledge and process optimisation<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for a broad set of financial accounting and reporting processes concerning the Group’s legal entities, incl. month-end closing, reconciliations, statutory accounts, as well as for performing internal controls. You’ll furthermore play a large role in process optimisation, aided by your significant experience in the field. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Welcome to Financial Accounting &amp; Controlling<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Financial Accounting team where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for delivering standardised, high-quality, and timely accounting and reporting products within FAC. You’ll join a workplace culture centred around teamwork and development through a close collaboration with your colleagues and stakeholders within and outside of FAC department.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>preparing appropriate financial journals and reconciling your entities’ accounts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing statutory accounts and providing high quality audit documentation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> reporting on a number of legal entities for group reporting purposes (IFRS)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> delivering on other local reporting requirements, e.g., VAT and National Statistics<\u002Fli>\n  <li> meeting requirements for Joint Venture reporting and other related deliverables<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving the continuous optimisation of processes – specifically in connection with month-end closing and our reporting systems.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a bachelor’s degree in accounting, controlling, or similar<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have extensive relevant experience working in a public accounting firm or a controlling department in an international company, incl. thorough knowledge of IFRS<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English at an academic level, can communicate clearly in writing, and excel at communicating financial issues in a readily understandable language<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have an analytical and logical approach to issues as well as the ability to critically handle information you receive<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are results-oriented and set visible and relevant goals for your tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in a changing environment, take independent responsibility, and enjoy working with colleagues across teams and national borders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. reporting products, servicing an ambitious, multinational green company <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for leading two teams totalling c. 10-12 colleagues. The Financial Accounting department is organised by region and comprises eight teams. The larger regions cover c. 60 separate legal entities. The core tasks of each region are to ensure high quality bookkeeping and accounting, meeting key deadlines within our month end\u002Fyear end close process with a strong focus on local audit and statutory accounts processes. There is also a key emphasis on local audit and statutory account preparation among a range of local reporting and joint venture reporting products. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Welcome to Financial Accounting and Controlling (FAC)<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Financial Accounting where you, together with your colleagues, will ensure high quality booking keeping and accounting, balance sheet reconciliations, and meet key deliverables and deadlines within our month end \u002F year end close process. You’ll be one of two managers reporting directly to the Head of Financial Accounting. FAC forms part of a wider shared services function within Ørsted: Ørsted Business Services. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>creating a workplace that motivates and drives your team members, empowering them in daily decision-making, as well as providing challenges and guidance for their continual development<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being delivery of key milestones and deadlines of our financial reporting products, such as month end close deliverables, financial recons and VAT, JV, and local government reporting.<\u002Fli>\n world that runs entirely on green energy <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll work on innovative IT cloud solutions in the ever-changing and digitalised world. You’ll play a key role in streamlining technologies and adopting them to be faster, more flexible, and more resilient. Find out how IT can supercharge climate action and join a fascinating green transformation journey to create a world that is powered by renewable energy.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to the Cloud Acceleration team<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of a new, cross-functional, international agile team where you, together with your colleagues, will develop core products based on the cloud technology. This includes full scope of cloud lifecycle activities. Work with enthusiastic people with a global mindset and enjoy an innovative environment where challenging and interesting work with purpose is part of daily life. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>developing governance, management, and security patterns on the newly built cloud platform<\u002Fli>\n  <li> designing connectivity, infrastructure, identity, and access management and monitoring components in platform and application landing zone<\u002Fli>\n  <li> taking part in developing and implementing scalable and modular landing zones<\u002Fli>\n  <li> evaluating existing systems, solutions, and processes and providing ideas for migration from on-prem to cloud.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have solid experience in baselining cloud Identity, Security, Monitoring, Resource Consistency, and Deployment Acceleration<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with AWS Identity and access management (IAM) policy implementation and governance (SCPs)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with containerisation technologies like Docker or container orchestration tools, like Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) or Elastic Container Service (ECS) with the ability to incorporate IT and data security<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess knowledge about AWS cloud governance, deployment, automation, and compliance reporting, like AWS Organizations, AWS System Manager<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are familiar with Infrastructure as a Code (Terraform), automation tools and ServiceNow integration<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are familiar with Bash or Power Shell scripting.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. Work with enthusiastic people with a global mindset and enjoy an innovative environment where challenging and interesting work with purpose is part of daily life.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>co-shaping cloud product vision and underlying product catalogue<\u002Fli>\n  <li> defining roadmap required to achieve intended objectives in alignment with product teams, cloud provider, and delivery organisations across Ørsted<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving implementation of new AWS cloud and ensuring continuous improvement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> maintaining feature backlog based on input from leadership and key stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting setting up relevant product teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> proactively addressing identified risks and impediments.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a profound understanding of AWS cloud technical aspects, preferably working experience within<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are self-driven and work independently<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong stakeholder management skills and ability to mediate opposing viewpoints<\u002Fli>\n  <li> apply continuous improvement mindset<\u002Fli>\n  <li> present information in a concise and comprehensive manner to both business and technical stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. operation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of our windfarms <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll support our Polish and German programs of offshore wind farms. You’ll be working in teams that are responsible for high voltage and low voltage commissioning, maintenance, operation, and troubleshooting of equipment in accordance with our electrical safety rules.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Electrical Safety<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Electrical Safety team where you, together with your colleagues, will supervise colleagues operating, maintaining, and repairing HV and LV equipment throughout the region and you’ll join a team of highly skilled high voltage senior authorized persons. While on site, you’ll report directly to the lead commissioning windfarm manager and your functional line manager for your further development. We cultivate a safety-focused, collaborative, dynamic, and diverse work environment and encourage career-long learning and development <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>maintaining safety of all persons working on or near high voltage electrical equipment throughout commissioning, energisation, testing, and long-term operation of new windfarm facilities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing, issuing, and cancelling safety documents and checks of work permits<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting wind farm commissioning project management in witnessing and executing acceptance tests, energisation, and commissioning scope throughout the construction phase<\u002Fli>\n  <li> fostering a culture of safety at new offshore windfarm facilities in Germany and Poland, and mentoring and training team members on our electrical safety rules<\u002Fli>\n  <li> overseeing high voltage electrical installations to wind turbines, offshore substations, HV sub-marine and onshore cables, onshore substations, and grid connections.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have at least five years of electrical working and maintenance experience operating under a safe system of high voltage work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have at least one year working experience within onshore substation systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience managing high voltage switching activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are willing to work offshore during commissioning time periods and able to clear medical checks and safety training programs as required by Global Wind Organisation (GWO) standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> become certified as a senior authorized person under our electrical safety rules.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Joergen Elmstroem, Head of Electrical Safety, on (+1) 8572751478, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that you’re expected to do regular travelling in relation to your work, as you’ll be working in different construction sites both offshore and onshore, with onshore locations in Emden in Germany, Warsaw in Poland, and Copenhagen in Denmark. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most A large part of this concerns compliance with ISO 27001, combined with our internal requirement for building assets based on IEC 62443. The combination of the two standards will ensure a high level of cybersecurity for the assets.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to OT Communication Systems<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the OT Component Security team where you, together with your colleagues, will enforce compliance with the cybersecurity regulations in the country in which we’re constructing and operating our assets, as well as our own internal requirements. In this role, you might focus on development or operations projects depending on your and our organisation’s preferences and needs. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>ensuring compliance with our organisation’s ISMS, NERC-CIP, and ISO 27001<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working across a range of packages constituting an offshore wind farm to help ensure their compliance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being responsible for the integration of our internal IT security services<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring that the wind farms continue to operate safely. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have practical experience in the ISO 2700X suite of standards and in IEC 62443<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have project work or management experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are good at collaborating with a range of stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with network, component, and server security, as this is a great advantage.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 28 February 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> For the position Poland, please don’t hesitate administration, stabilising performance, and resolving very complex incidents that very often need direct coordination with Microsoft. Our project team is IT driven and consists of ten consultants sharing a passion for Business intelligence. As a team, we ensure you’ve got a safe space that enables you to bring your whole self to work. You’ll be encouraged to attend multiple trainings and events allowing you to take your career towards desired direction.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>performing landscape administration tasks e.g., setting up and maintaining gateways, auditing licenses, and developing best practices for business users<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing proactive support for application and operational issues across the production environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working closely with the business while developing PoCs for sophisticated solutions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> handling various support requests related to our Power BI platform<\u002Fli>\n  <li> monitoring, maintaining, improving, and upgrading our Power BI solution on a regular basis by taking over tasks set by the Technical Applications Responsible.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have experience with Power BI Service, Power BI Premium administration, and, possibly, landscape governance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a knack for configuring and troubleshooting gateways, using REST API for Power BI and built custom connectors<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can troubleshoot and develop Power BI reports, incl. Work with enthusiastic people with a global mindset and enjoy an innovative environment where challenging and interesting work with purpose is part of daily life. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>designing and implementing new cloud network infrastructure designed for high availability, security, and easy maintenance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the development of automating cloud platform<\u002Fli>\n  <li> liaising with our cloud architects, network architects, enterprise architects, and key stakeholders to design and implement new features to support our growing global business<\u002Fli>\n  <li> participating in cloud network operations, maintenance, and deployment tasks.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>are proficient in operating and deploying network infrastructure in the AWS cloud<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience working with hybrid cloud environment and cloud migration strategies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with infrastructure automation tools and are drawn towards Infrastructure as Code (IaC)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are familiar with DevOps methodologies, practices, and tools like Azure DevOps, Git, PowerShell\u002FBash, Ansible, Terraform, Docker, and Kubernetes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preferably hold a Cisco CCNP\u002FCCNA certification or equivalent knowledge and are familiar with Palo Alto products<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can provide up-to-date knowledge in network design, planning, implementation, and troubleshooting, with experience in managing Cisco SD-WAN, Cisco ASR\u002FCSR\u002F8000v, Nexus 5K\u002F9K, and Cisco ACI.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 13 February 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> For the position in Poland or Denmark, please don’t hesitate to contact Michal Zdanowski, Head of Infrastructure ＆ SO, on (Poland +48) 573790082, if you’d like to know more about the position. <\u002Fp>\n <p>If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 13 February 2023, 23:59 CEST <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> Poland, Denmark, Malaysia <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Warsaw, Gentofte, Kuala Lumpur <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Hybrid (office and home-working) <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Michal Zdanowski <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Head of Infrastructure &amp; transforming our green energy journey on a global scale <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll empower our developers by automating their code deployment with a DevOps mindset and drive Infrastructure as Code harnessing the Cloud. You’ll provide our developers and IT infrastructure teams with capabilities to automate and code deployment and provision of Infrastructure with Cloud native tooling, pushing, and enabling the DevOps mindset.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to IT Infrastructure and Service Operations CC<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> You’ll be part of Production Infrastructure 1 team where you, together with your colleagues, will operate and govern the Cloud Platform for the entire organisation. You’ll interact with a wide array of highly skilled and ambitious development teams and infrastructure specialists harnessing Azure DevOps, containerisation, CI\u002FCD pipelines, and other cutting-edge automation. As a team, we take responsibility of our own development and, most importantly, set a friendly collaboration atmosphere.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>developing, implementing, and maintaining features with CI\u002FCD Azure Pipelines to ensure automated code deployment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing governance on agreed coding standards, documentation standards, and repositories<\u002Fli>\n  <li> evaluating existing systems, solutions, and processes and providing ideas for improvement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> prioritising and enforcing security and governance on the entire cloud platform using Azure Policies, Defender, and other tools.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have solid experience with Azure development, preferably from automation development using CI\u002FCD pipelines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with access management with setup of RBAC roles and authorisations in Azure<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with Containerization and Orchestration, where Kubernetes cluster setup experience is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess knowledge about Cloud Governance: Azure Policies deployment, automation, and compliance reporting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with provisioning Azure DevOps and Terraform, with knowledge of GitHub being a plus.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Send your application to us no later than 21 February 2023. geophysical survey solutions for offshore wind development<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll contribute to leading the industry into the next decade of geophysical surveys for offshore wind farm development. As a geophysicist, you’ll be responsible for the geophysical survey aspects in all project phases and experience how the offshore wind power business looks from the front line. Furthermore, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to the development of new tools and innovative solutions for further enhanced value creation across the Ørsted portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to GEO<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Geophysical Surveys where you, together with your colleagues, will handle the technical management of the geophysical surveys and challenge the survey industry standards by constantly striving for continuous improvements. The Geophysical Surveys team consists of 15 dedicated people spread across three countries who design and execute high-quality geophysical surveys in order to support the engineering challenges and regulatory requirements in our projects. As a team, we acknowledge that good performance and a meaningful work culture comes out of strong relations, mutual trust, curiosity, and a psychologically safe environment where every voice counts.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>being responsible for designing geophysical surveys, incl. preparation of technical material, participation in kick-off meetings with various contractors, mobilisations, and port calls<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being responsible for managing survey operations and contractor deliveries, incl. vessel calls, weekly processing meetings with contractors, and data quality assurance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> UXO risk mitigation from the development phase towards the construction of our offshore wind farms<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being responsible for driving quality into the acquired data and maximising its value through proactive stakeholder engagement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> joining a project-specific site investigation team consisting of project managers, geophysical assessment engineers, geotechnical engineers, and construction managers.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have extensive offshore experience within shallow geophysical data acquisition and processing, incl. bathymetry, side-scan sonar, magnetometer, sub-bottom profiler, and UHR seismic methods<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a relevant degree in earth sciences<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English fluently<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent communication skills, enabling you to convey your messages smoothly and efficiently when interacting with your stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a proactive and systematic approach to your work tasks and thrive on being in a dynamic working environment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 29 January 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Jeppe Bloch Lauridsen, Head of Geophysical Surveys, on (Denmark +45) 99554757, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that you’re expected to do some travelling in relation to your work, as you’ll be participating in kick-off meetings, processing meetings, and other project meetings, as well as various departmental activities over the cycle of a year.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the Be prepared to share your passion for cloud with a team of hands-on developers and an application architect – being their voice in the company. We offer flexibility and value the opportunity of being onsite at our office regularly to form a sense of community.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>setting and driving the direction for our DevOps platforms transformation in the whole IT organisation and beyond, in close cooperation with architects in cloud, security, and infrastructure teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing K8s and microservices expertise and guidance to our community of practice by inspiring and coordinating new and ongoing initiatives in fields like automation, security, and tooling<\u002Fli>\n  <li> strengthening our community of cloud architects and functional specialists by sharing your experiences and generally contributing with relevant perspectives on the cloud architecture<\u002Fli>\n  <li> identifying and maturing organisational improvements to be prioritised for implementation within CoP and further developing strong stakeholder relations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the continuous delivery together with the DevOps teams.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>are a team player with strong technical skills, motivated to drive the K8s platform agenda in close co-operation with the business<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have proven experience deploying and managing Kubernetes and working with Cloud providers, preferably with Azure, incl. experience with infrastructure as a Code <\u002Fli>\n  <li>have extensive knowledge of at least one language such as Python, Go Bash, or PowerShell and know good programming practices, e.g., working with Git, pull requests and applying good programming patterns like DRY<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have documented experience with CI\u002FCD pipelines, preferably using Azure DevOps, where knowledge of best practices relating to security and automation would be a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a deep, hands-on understanding of microservice and event-driven architectural patterns where knowledge of enterprise integration patterns and technologies within the integrations area will be a welcome addition<\u002Fli>\n  <li> experience with Operational Technology environments, the Purdue network model, and related security implications would be a plus.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Send your application to us no later than 31 January 2023. transformation of green energy production <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be part of a wonderful team, building our cloud and Kubernetes services that are pivotal for the digital transformation of the energy trading area. We’re in the midst of a large transformation program moving from on-premises to cloud infrastructure for our trading and risk management functions. You’ll be one of almost thirty specialists within a competence centre where your personal and professional development is prioritised.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Markets &amp; Risk ART<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Trading, Integration &amp; Middleware Competence Centre where you, together with your engaged and supportive colleagues, will build and operate strong Kubernetes and related cloud services. These services will be used for our algorithmic trading capabilities, as well as market operations for our wind farms. We work in a matrix structure where you’ll cooperate closely with traders, analysts, developers, and integration colleagues in a scrum team in the Markets &amp; Risk ART (SAFe Agile Release Train). <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>setting up, maintaining, and operating Kubernetes clusters in Azure and most probably AWS in the near future<\u002Fli>\n  <li> maturing Infrastructure as Code (IaC) implementation and deployment to provide self-service capabilities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing Kubernetes expertise and guidance to business and developer colleagues<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the continuous delivery together with the DevOps teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> cooperating closely with cloud architects to comply with company standards.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>are a team player with strong technical skills, motivated by transforming the technology in close co-operation with a variety of stakeholders, experienced in working with an agile methodology in an international, English-speaking environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience working with it, preferably with Terraform<\u002Fli>\n  <li> understand enterprise integration patterns and general IT security within the integration area and are familiar with CI\u002FCD pipelines, preferably with Azure DevOps <\u002Fli>\n  <li>preferably have knowledge of good security and automation practices.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. and establishing next-generation firewall features and capabilities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing analysis and recommendations for the continuous improvement of cloud network and security (AWS)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> maintaining, deploying, upgrading, and troubleshooting network security infrastructure solutions, incl. firewalls, load balancers, client VPN, and Intrusion Prevention Systems.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have strong work experience architecting public or multi-cloud networks and security<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are experienced within cloud networking, software-defined networking, firewalls (e.g., Palo Alto) and load balancers (e.g. Citrix NetScaler)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have solid experience and certifications within WAN, LAN, Wireless, Routers, Switches, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have solid experience with Cisco network technologies, e.g., Cisco ACI, Cisco SD-WAN<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with multi-cloud network architecture (e.g., Aviatrix), infrastructure architecture, solution design, and documentation, as well as global peering solutions and scaling hybrid deployments (e.g., Equinix)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess general knowledge about cloud computing, incl. utilising infrastructure components, designing infrastructure architecture solutions in public and hybrid clouds, as well as knowledge about infrastructure security architecture.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major skills, working together with relevant stakeholders to ensure systems are secure, reliable, maintainable, scalable, robust, and performing well<\u002Fli>\n  <li> translating requirements into trailblazing architectures for modern applications, enforcing cloud-native architecture principles which fit best across technical, operational, and management standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> cooperating
